SENT.plain: We report 2 cases of hypothyroidism in whom the associated haematological disturbances (macrocytic anaemia in both cases, mild leukopenia and thrombopenia in one patient) failed to be corrected by thyroid hormone replacement therapy
Further investigations led to the diagnosis of acute myeloid leukaemia (AML) in the first patient and myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) in the other
The reasons of the delayed diagnosis and the possible mechanisms explaining this rare combination are discussed
The hypothesis of a purely coincidental association seems most likely
